data.title: Upscale Trendy with Great Food and Beer
data.text:
Planktown is nice enough for a date and relaxed enough for the game.  The menu has several selections and appears to have a couple beef entrees, a chicken entree and a fish entree. In this area the restaurant would not be complete without a vegan dish as well.  The menu had a number of delicious looking salads. The night we stooped in the special was Steelhead which my wife ordered and was reported to be excellent.  I ordered the steak and was pleased with the quality and how they cooked it.  The sides appeared fresh made and delicious.

The restaurant also brews their own beer and has other selections.  If you like craft beers then you better bring a designated driver.

The service was very good and attentive.

data.title: Great Beer, Food and Staff
data.text: We were in town for a family birthday and stopped in to PT on a Friday (they were kind enough to give us a reservation for 8). The hostess seated us towards the back where it was quieter which was great and our waitress, Jesse, was awesome and provided excellent service. We tried several beers, appetizers (pulled pork fries with cheese really are that good!), entrees and burgers. The steelhead and cod were exceptional. Both IPA's were a hit and everyone in the party had a great experience.

data.title: Fun Vibes here!
data.text: Great gathering place with a pleasant atmosphere.  Food is tasty, and the beer selection is good. Good place to meet up with friends.  Conveniently located.

data.title: Excellent lunch
data.text: I enjoyed an Agrulua salad with beets, hazel nuts, feta cheese with smoked steel head. It was excellent. I would eat it everyday if I had access to it. This was paired with the Blue Lake Pilsner.

data.title: Nice lunch with excellent nitro beer
data.text: My friend and I went for lunch here. I had a small plate, the chicken tacos, which were very tasty. I also had their special nitro Amber beer which was excellent, smooth and non-hoppy. My friend and I split a dessert chocolate Grenache with hazelnut crust and topping,wow!!! Very delicious and filling enough for two. Our waiter was attentive, friendly and knowledgeable. Great place for lunch. It can get pretty crowded fast!

data.title: Delicious
data.text:
With the Olympic Trials coming up, I definitely recommend travelers to take the short ride over to Springfield and try out Planktown. 

Though the service is spotty, the food is undeniably amazing - and so is the beer. 

Definitely one of my "Go-to" breweries in Eugene/Springfield.

data.title: Good pub food
data.text: This is a cool place but a bit on the noisy side , I liked the food , it is right in downtown on Main Street . The service is always friendly . The fries are very good

data.title: Ok
data.text: Beer was ok and the service was fine.  I wasn't impressed with the food though.  Lots of kids in the building for a brew pub.

data.title: Fun old atmosphere
data.text: Amazing cold beer, great burgers and yummy fries!  Husband and I came in and didn't really know what to expect.  Service was great, food amazing and location not too bad either.  Just a hop skip and a  jump from the University of Oregon!

data.title: Great, hearty food. Good beer.
data.text: Went here as a group of four. Took a while to be seated, but it was a Friday night and during some big events in Eugene. The service was great - our server was quick and took care of our drinks (Rumplestiltskin and Blood Orange cider). The whole table ordered burgers 1 Bacon w/ cheese (not on the menu but did it anyway), 2 bacon Irish cheddar burgers, and 1 regular. All with fries. They were all cooked as requested and tasted amazing! The ketchup and ranch for fries is unique - not bad, but different than your run-of-the-mill Heinz and Hidden Valley. Great, lively atmosphere!! There is also a little merchandise shop if you fancy their glasses and such.

data.title: Plenty of options to satisfy 5 very different people
data.text: Our server knew every last detail about all of the options on the menu which was very helpful considering some of the offerings were a little funky.  They offer comfort food to healthy options. We will absolutely go back for a second wonderful meal.

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: Went for a birthday celebration. A good variety of food for young and old. A good variety of beer and wine. So popular that you may have to wait a bit for a table but worth it.

data.title: Fun place in down town Springfield
data.text: One of the only brew pubs I'm aware of in Springfield. Planktown can compete with some of the more popular breweries in Eugene. Nestled in a historic store front right off of main, in a large open seating are. The food was good, and the service was okay.  We had a large group and everyone loved what they got, from the hamburgers to the fried oysters. A must stop. I grew up here, and it's fun to "come home" to something trendy and fun that didn't exist when I lived here.

data.title: okay
data.text:
Below average beer. 
Terrible bar service for a mixed drink.  I was about done with my food before my drink arrived. This happened on two occasions. Haven't been back since.

Food, good.

data.title: Fun Atmosphere and Good Food
data.text: I visited Planktown with a friend, and we both got the beer flight. She got the lights, and I got the darks. The place was super busy, so we ate at the bar. The bartender was very attentive with our drinks and food order, but our food took a very long time to get to us. My friend had the burger, and she loved the cheese sauce with her fries. I ordered the tacos, but the sauce was too spicy for me. This place has a variety of food on their menu, and the beer was good.

data.title: Good pub feel
data.text:
Good food, and good service. They have some unexpected items on the menu. Very quick to offer tastes of their beers. Good beers too 
Because of the tall hard ceilings it's a bit loud. No Tv's either. Not necessary but one or two would be nice.

data.title: Good beer nice atmosphere
data.text: We were there for an event they were celebrating. We got an amazing deal on their newly released beer at the time. I'm disappointed we didn't try the food while we were there. That is the only reason I did not give it 5 stars! Definitely a hidden gem in downtown Springfield.

data.title: Good food, great service
data.text: I went to Planktown with a girlfriend for lunch. The service was great!  We had the asparagus for an appetizer and it was delicious!

data.title: Great food choice in Springfield
data.text: Used outdoor seating as we had our dogs with us. The sever brought a bowl of water for the "kids". The server allowed us to modify our order for a gluten free option. Our sever was attentative but not overbearing.
Went in for a late breakfast/lunch. Shared the biscuits and gravy and the vegie omlet. Just enough food and the food was excellent. Will definitely go there again! Great service too!
